title: How to Make Kumquat Pickle (Sweet)

steps.headline: Cut each fruit, divide into equal halves.
Place fruit into a container and marinate with a handful of salt and 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of turmeric powder.
steps.description: Mix well and leave aside for 3 days. This process  will drain off excess liquid from the fruit.

steps.headline: On day THREE, remove fruit from container and throw away excess liquid that would have accumulated at the bottom of container.
Leave fruit aside for later use.
Dissolve sugar into vinegar.
steps.description: Mix well until most of sugar dissolves in vinegar.

steps.headline: Place into a pot and allow vinegar to come to a boil.
Add cinnamon, cloves, saffron strands and cardamom into boiling vinegar.
Continue to boil until a syrup starts to form.
Remove from stove, as the syrup begins to thicken.
Do not allow syrup to thicken completely.
steps.description: Must be removed before this process( thickening) takes place.

steps.headline: Leave syrup aside and allow to cool.
Now add chili, turmeric powder to kumquats.
Mix mustard powder in a tablespoon of water and also add to kumquats.
Add syrup to kumquats.
steps.description: Mix well and store in a glass bottle or other suitable container.

steps.headline: Can be served with any main meal or savories.

text: Cut each fruit, divide into equal halves.  Place fruit into a container and marinate with a handful of salt and 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of turmeric powder. Mix well and leave aside for 3 days. This process  will drain off excess liquid from the fruit. On day THREE, remove fruit from container and throw away excess liquid that would have accumulated at the bottom of container.  Leave fruit aside for later use.  Dissolve sugar into vinegar. Mix well until most of sugar dissolves in vinegar. Place into a pot and allow vinegar to come to a boil.  Add cinnamon, cloves, saffron strands and cardamom into boiling vinegar.  Continue to boil until a syrup starts to form.  Remove from stove, as the syrup begins to thicken.  Do not allow syrup to thicken completely. Must be removed before this process( thickening) takes place. Leave syrup aside and allow to cool.  Now add chili, turmeric powder to kumquats.  Mix mustard powder in a tablespoon of water and also add to kumquats.  Mix well.  Add syrup to kumquats. Mix well and store in a glass bottle or other suitable container. Refrigerate and use when required.  Can be served with any main meal or savories.
